text:
See bottom of section 5.8.3:

requiredFeatures is often used in conjunction with the 'switch' element. If the 
requiredFeatures is used in other situations,
then it represents a simple switch on the given element whether to render the 
element or not.

Regression test:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>
<!DOCTYPE svg PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD SVG 20010904//EN" 
"http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-SVG-20010904/DTD/svg10.dtd">
<svg xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 200 200" 
xml:space="preserve">
	<title>
		<!-- Title of the document -->
	</title>
	<metadata>
		<!-- Metadata -->
	</metadata>
	<desc>
		<!-- put a description here -->
	</desc>
	<switch>
		<text x="20" y="100" 
requiredFeatures="org.w3c.svg.dynamic">Animation exists</text>
		<text x="20" y="100">Animation does not exist</text>
	</switch>
	<text x="20" y="150" requiredFeatures="org.w3c.svg.dynamic">Animation 
controlled per object</text>
</svg>
